entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph and central Pocahontas Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Snowshoe, or 10 miles north of Cass Scenic Railroad, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 10:53AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming continues the Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt will continue to slow due to cooler temperatures, decreasing flows on tributaries feeding the Bear River. Water levels are expected to gradually decrease through the week as a result.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 10:46AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt will slow due to cooler temperatures. River levels are expected to peak Saturday, and then will begin to decrease Sunday and into the week.
